channel.title: GDB on Tian Jiale's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in GDB on Tian Jiale's Blog

item.title: Brief Instructions for Using GDB
item.description: What is GDBï¼Ÿ GDB is the GNU Project debugger that allows you to see what’s going on “inside” another program while it’s executing – or what another program was doing when it crashed. There are four main things GDB can do (plus other things to support them) to help you catch errors on the fly: Start the program, specifying anything that might affect its behavior. Causes your program to stop on specified conditions.
